values:
Haven't used this in a long time, but why not? I would like anyone who wishes/still uses this on my friends list to answer these questions for me. Thanks! Have a great summer y'all!

Are you currently in a serious relationship?

What was your dream growing up?

What talent do you wish you had?

If I bought you a drink what would it be?

Favorite vegetable?

What was the last book you read?

What zodiac sign are you?

Any Tattoos and/or Piercings? Explain where.

Worst Habit?

If you saw me walking down the street, would you offer me a ride?

What is your favorite sport?

Do you have a pessimistic or optimistic attitude?

What would you do if you were stuck in an elevator with me?

Worst thing to ever happen to you?

Tell me one weird fact about you.

Do you have any pets?

What if I showed up at your house unexpectedly?

What was your first impression of me?

Do you think clowns are cute or scary?

If you could change one thing about how you look, what would it be?

Would you be my crime partner or my conscience?

What color eyes do you have?

Ever been arrested?

White or red wine?

If you won $10,000 today, what would you do with it?

What's your favorite place to hang at?

Do you believe in ghosts?

Favorite thing to do in your spare time?

Do you swear a lot?

Biggest pet peeve?

In one word, how would you describe yourself?

Do you believe/appreciate romance?

Do you believe in God?

Will you repost this so I can fill it out and do the same for you?

Oooh... Oooh... Ohhh..
No matter what you say about love,
I keep coming back for more,
My head in the fire,
Sooner or later I get what I'm asking for
No matter what you say about life,
I learn every time I bleed.
The truth is a stranger
My soul is in danger,
I gotta let my spirit be free to,
Admit that I was wrong and then change my mind.
Sorry but I have to move on and leave you behind.

I can't waste time so give me the moment
I realize nothing's broken
No need to worry about everything I've done
Lived every second like it was my last one.
Don't look back got a new direction
Loved you once, needed protection.
You're still a part of everything I do, you're on my heart just like a tattoo,
Just like a tattoo, I'll always have you.

I'm sick of playing all of these games
It's not about taking ties.
When I look in the mirror,
Didn't deliver
It hurt enough to think that I could stop
Admit that I'm wrong and then change my mind.
Sorry but I gotta be strong and leave you behind

I can't waste time so give me the moment
I realize nothing's broken
No need to worry about everything I've done
Lived every second like it was my last one.
Don't look back got a new direction
Loved you once, needed protection
You're still a part of everything I do, you're on my heart just like a tattoo, I'll always have you.

If I live every moment
Won't change any moment
Still a part of me and you.
I will never regret you
Still the memory of you
Marks everything I do.

I can't waste time so give me the moment
I realize nothing's broken
No need to worry about everything I've done
Lived every second like it was my last one
Don't look back got a new direction
Loved you once, needed protection.
You're still a part of everything I do, you're on my heart just like a tattoo.
Just like a tattoo
I'll always have you.

So, it's been ages since I've said anything... at least it feels like ages. I'm done with school in two weeks. How insane is that? I'm going to be a sophomore and actually doing research this summer. It's completely insane and I'm not really sure I'm ready for it all yet. I don't know what to think or what to feel really...it's all insanity. 

I just want to curl up in my bed and sleep for a good 24-48hrs. But I have to get through these next two weeks. Last final week I hardly slept...I need to make sure I don't do another repeat of that...*sigh*

Can't wait for summer..that is what getting me through these next few days...

I've been living with a shadow overhead 
I've been sleeping with a cloud above my bed 
I've been lonely for so long 
Trapped in the past, I just can't seem to move on 

I've been hiding all my hopes and dreams away 
Just in case I ever need em again someday 
I've been setting aside time 
To clear a little space in the corners of my mind 

All I want to do is find a way back into love 
I can't make it through without a way back into love 
Oh oh oh 

I've been watching but the stars refuse to shine 
I've been searching but I just don't see the signs 
I know that it's out there 
There's got to be something for my soul somewhere 

I've been looking for someone to shed some light 
Not just somebody just to get me through the night 
I could use some direction 
And I'm open to your suggestions 

All I want to do is find a way back into love 
I can't make it through without a way back into love 
And if I open my heart again 
I guess I'm hoping you'll be there for me in the end 

There are moments when I don't know if it's real 
Or if anybody feels the way I feel 
I need inspiration 
Not just another negotiation 

All I want to do is find a way back into love 
I can't make it through without a way back into love 
And if I open my heart to you 
I'm hoping you'll show me what to do 
And if you help me to start again 
You know that I'll be there for you in the end

I was reading an article that my writing workshop professor handed out and there was a quote that caught my attention. 
<center>"Writing is a form of personal freedom. It frees us from the mass identity we see in the making all around us. In the end, writers will write not to be outlaw heroes of some underculture but mainly to save themselves, to survive as individuals." </center>

I think that explains in a nutshell why I still have this livejournal. I started it because someone told me about it. But I'm still writing in it because its a way for me to express my ideas without people giving me weird looks to tell me I'm overreacting. I can write anything I feel, no matter how silly it might be, without fear of judgment.

I'm very tired and dizzy from all the turns in country western dancing, but that is an amazing class! :)

It feels like I'm back in Massachusetts. It has been raining ice for the past two days and because it is the south...they put no salt or sand on the road and campus has been closed. The only think open is Mabee because all the stairs to get to upper campus are closed off with the inches of ice on them. Needless to say I'm going crazy...there isn't any real work to do because I haven't had that many classes! It's starting to get annoying because we can't even leave campus because all the cars are covered with ice and the roads are a mess or closed.

There was a henna party the other day though. I have a pretty design on my hand which makes me happy, now if I only had a place to wear it to...

I hope classes start and I can just move on. Sitting around lets my mind wonder and when my mind wonders I start dreaming and wishing...and none of those dreams are coming true lately...I'm so tired of being disappointed.

This is a beautiful song that I just listened to the other day after not listening to it for a good year. I just thought I'd share...I think I might have before...but it's amazing and it's good to listen to when you are a little frustrated...

What Makes You Different, Makes you Beautiful :: Backstreet Boys

You don't run with the crowd
You go your own way
You don't play after dark
You light up my day
Got your own kind of style
That set you apart
Baby that why you capture my heart

I know sometimes you feel
Like you don't fit in
And this world doesn't know
What you have within
When I look at you
I see something rare
A rose can grow anywhere
And there is no one I know that can compare

What makes you different (makes you beautiful)
What's there inside you (shining still to you)
In your eyes I see
All the love I'll ever need
What makes you different makes you beautiful to me

You got something so real
You touch me so deep
See what's in your fade
Don't matter to me
So come as you are
You got nothing to prove
You want me with all that you do
And I want to take this chance to say to you

What makes you different (makes you beautiful)
What's there inside you (shining still to you)
In your eyes I see
All the love I'll ever need
What makes you different makes you beautiful to me

You don't know how you touch my life
Always so many ways I just scared to try
You taught me what love is supposed to be
You saw the little things that make you beautiful to me

What makes you different (makes you beautiful)
What's there inside you (shining still to you)
In your eyes I see
All the love I'll ever need
What makes you different makes you beautiful to me

I went on a walk with my mom tonight. It's a beautiful night here and being away from the center of the city I can finally see stars. I've always loved looking up into the sky at the clouds or just at the stars and the moon. If you've ever seen the way I decorate my room that shouldn't be a surprise. The only constellation I can really remember from elementary school is Orion, which happens to be right over my house tonight...a sort of guardian angel. 

I've been in a weird mood for the majority of this week. I've kind been thinking too much and have been pulled into myself in a sense. I get this way when I get really stressed out, but I think this comes from not knowing and just taking it to heart. I've always been really emotional...sometimes it's a strength because I'm passionate about my work, and sometimes it's a downfall because I can't always bounce back quickly. So I'm sort of suck here for now and I don't really know if I want to come out. I think I need a break from caring about...I'm opening to get some answers soon and I'm really getting nervous. Knowing my luck though, nothing is going to happen and I'll be left without closure once again. CeCe is coming Saturday and I move back in Sunday...wish me luck?

I just have to comment on the beautiful weather here. It was 60 degrees today and nice and sunny. I love being able to walk outside with just a light sweater and now worry about freezing. It makes it very easy to walk around the track...which I'm going to start as soon as classes start again. Maybe I'll even start running again.

This break has been filled with my hiding out in my room and reading. I've been doing just that for the past two hours. Right now I'm reading Wicked which has been very entertaining. I've read about 7 books so far this break. A few of them were mystery books from a series I haven't been able to read since the summer. I've decided to keep up with my running during classes, hopefully I'll have some time. Reading for me though is an escape of sorts. I get so involved in the book, if it's a good one, and I am able to forget about all the other things that bother my mind. I hide out in my books you might say until I can do something about what I'm thinking about.

The closer school starts the more nervous I get about the whole situation. I feel like I messed up the last two weeks of the semester. Then a part of me says, who cares what everyone else thinks. You did want you did and you didn't mean anything by it. I bounce between feeling like I need people around me and I need to make them happy and the feeling that I need to make myself happy and just not worry about peoples' thoughts of me so much. I'm usually a very independent person, but what people don't realize is I need to have people around me that care about me sometimes when I feel vulnerable. I'm not interesting in making casual friends and probably come off as kind of cold just because I don't open up to them as much. Oh well...I've pretty much given up trying please people after high school experiences...I just still harbor a guilty feeling sometimes...even though I probably shouldn't.

1. Was 2006 a good year for you?
The beginning was amazing, but the end was a little rocky

2. What did you do in 2006 that you'd never done before?
went to a club to do some dancing...so much fun!

3. Did you keep your New Years' resolutions, and will you make more for next year?
I don't think I made any...and I won't this year

4. What was your favorite moment of the year?
Littleton Prom

5. What was your least favorite moment of the year?
July

6. What would you like to have in 2007 that you lacked in 2006?
I don't know what I lacked in 2006...

7. What date from 2006 will remain etched upon your memory, and why?
Graduation for sure...and July 7th because I left MA

8. What was your biggest achievement of the year?
Getting a GPA of 3.75 in the first semester of college

9. What was your biggest failure?
Making stupid mistakes again

10. Did you suffer illness or injury?
Nope

11. Whose behavior merited celebration?
what?

12. Did you breakup with anyone in 2006?
it was mutual

13. Did you make any new friends in 2006?
mhm! all the cool kids on Witt 1st and then some

14. Did you travel outside of the U.S. in 2006?
nope

15. How many different states did you travel to in 2006?
two

16. Did you lose anybody close to you in 2006?
Yeah...a few friends 

17. Did you miss anybody in the past year?
Oh yes...so much it hurts

18. What was your favorite movie you saw in 2006?
Mmmm...I really liked Devil Wears Prada...but Butterfly Effect was good too

19. What was your favorite song?
Too many to remember...I like "Life Ain't Always Beautiful" by Gary Allan

20. What was your favorite album?
Keith Urban's new one

21. Favorite TV show?
Project Runway

22. What was the best book you read?
Wicked

23. How many concerts did you see in 2006?
0

24. What was the funniest moment of 2006?
I dont know...whenever Juel and I laughed uncontrolably :)

25. What did you want and get?
I dont know..I wanted to go to Texas for college and now I'm here

26. What's one thing you wished happened in 2006?
I didn't have to say goodbye

27. Did you do anything you are ashamed of this year?
stupid mistakes

28. How much money did you spend in 2006?
too much

29. Where did most of your money go?
stuff for my dorm/college life

30. What was the best thing you bought?
i don't know

31. What was your most embarrassing moment of 2006?
i don't want to try to think of one

32. If you could go back in time to any moment of 2006, what would it be?
Senior year when I didn't have to worry about stupid people

33. What did you get really, really, really excited about?
Summer and the possibly of me seeing MA again

34. What song will always remind you of 2006?
Want To by Sugarland

35. Compared to this time last year, are you...
-happier or sadder? a bit sadder
-thinner or fatter? same
-richer or poorer? poorer

36. What do you wish you'd done more of?
At the beginning: hang out with friends, At the end: take more time for myself

37. What do you wish you'd done less of?
cry and worry

38. How will you be spending Christmas?
My house with family

39. Did you fall in love in 2006?
i fell in love a litte more

40. How many one-night stands?
none

41. What did you do on your birthday, and how old were you?
Did some shopping to celebrate 19 yrs

42. What one thing would have made your year immeasurably more satisfying?
not moving, or at least taking people with me

43. How would you describe your personal fashion concept in 2006?
no idea

44. What kept you sane?
Mason

45. Which celebrity/public figure did you fancy the most?
Johnny Depp

46. Who was the best new person you met?
CeCe!

47. Tell us a valuable life lesson you learned in 2006.
If you are going through hell...keep on going

48. What are your plans for 2007?
Getting happier

49. Quote a song lyric that sums up your year.
"Life ain't always beautiful, but it's a beautiful ride"

I can't believe I've been on break for a good two weeks now. It doesn't feel like it's been that long, where does all the time go? I'm not really complaining though, I'm ready to get the new semester started and to figure some things out finally.

Overall my break has been restful. I love getting 12 hours of sleep a night. It's been nice to sit and do nothing but read for hours on end. :)

Frustration has been a big theme though. I got through stages of acceptance and just a whatever feeling and then back to the frustration and wanting answers. Last night that's where I was yet again, but it helped a lot to talk it all out. I guess I'm just going to have to wait it out and see what happens in the coming weeks...

I want to wish you all a very Merry Christmas! It feels weird to not be freezing and have no snow on the ground, but I think it finally feels like Christmas for me.

<font size="1">
When the sun is hard to find 
When it's rainin' in your eyes 
When the shadows block 
those pretty little blue skies living inside you 
When the fallin of your tears
makes a candle disappear 
When you just can't see the light 
Baby I'll find a way to shine 
I'll find a way to shine 
</font>

I'm home and have been for the better part of this week. The semester is finally over and I'm happy and sad about it. All my friends live outside of San Antonio and most of them outside of Texas, it's going to be a long break. 

Overall the semester has been a good one. The beginning was a bit boring, but the end definitely got exciting, sometimes in the worse ways. I'm not having much luck in some departments and its a little frustrating. I'm taking a passive approach next semester. I'm going to throw myself into school and maybe get a job. I'll wait for things to come to me before I make a move, but me being forward about the situation hasn't worked out for me yet. It's annoying, but I'm tired of being disappointed. I'm not looking for amazing, amazing comes with experience. I'm just looking for something to be there and for arms to curl up in when I need to escape. Maybe things will work out better next semester...

I have a pile of books waiting for me and a lot of sleeping to do. 12 hours a night these past three days has been amazing. At least I will be able to relax this month. A friend might be coming to see me before school starts, that will be nice. Juel comes down in a month and a half! :) That is just amazing!

Life is interesting now. I'm not getting much sleep but I have enough nervous and restless energy in me that it doesn't really matter. I need to get a lot of crap done and I don't know if I have enough hours in the day to do it. Tomorrow is going to be a total nightmare. It makes me second guess biochem sometimes.

Here's a beautiful song. Kinda makes me teary eye, but I'm also overtired, so don't take my word for it.

I'm really excited right now! I got all the classes I wanted! *jumps up and down* My adviser thinks the course load is a lot, it's 16 hours with a max being 18. But I found out that the bio book is the one I kept!! And so is the Italian book I used! :) So, I'm feeling pretty excited. Even though this college seems more intense than WPI, I've learned the material already so it shouldn't be that big of a deal...hopefully.

So, I just wanted to share my excitement...even if it might be a little boring. I'm feeling pretty good right now! :)

Alone in this house again tonight 
I got the TV on, the sound turned down and a bottle of wine 
There's pictures of you and I on the walls around me 
The way that it was and could have been surrounds me 
I'll never get over you walkin' away 

I've never been the kind to ever let my feelings show 
And I thought that bein' strong meant never losin' your self-control 
But I'm just drunk enough to let got of my pain 
To hell with my pride, let it fall like rain 
From my eyes 
Tonight I wanna cry 

Would it help if I turned a sad song on 
"All By Myself" would sure hit me hard now that you're gone 
Or maybe unfold some old yellow lost love letters 
It's gonna hurt bad before it gets better 
But I'll never get over you by hidin' this way 

I've never been the kind to ever let my feelings show 
And I thought that bein' strong meant never losin' your self-control 
But I'm just drunk enough to let got of my pain 
To hell with my pride, let it fall like rain 
From my eyes 
Tonight I wanna cry

I finally made it and got settled in. I'm hanging out now in my room on my new pretty laptop. Things have been busy, a lot of boring info meeting. I'm pretty sure I bombed my CS assessment this morning. I know how to do things on the  computer, but don't ask me what the computer is doing to get it down. A lot of those questions I don't think anyone would know unless they were a computer geek and build computers. We will see how it all goes Monday. 

I found out I need to take a bio and a chem course this semester to get on my major plan. I've already gotten credit for the bio course, but I believe I need to take the lab. So, two science labs and a lecture shouldn't be too bad. I love sciences anyways. I don't have to worry about a calc class since I got credit for Calc I-III that makes me really happy! :)

I wish everyone luck with moving in and starting off this semester. We've all been there and done that, so I'm sure none of us will have any problems. :)

before I move in. It's scary and really exciting. I'm ready to get back into the school routine, but I'm having problems getting motivating to pack for the journey. I've been sitting around all summer waiting to move in and I'm still in that mind set. I have things I want to do before I leave Friday morning and I don't know why I have to push myself to get it all done. *shrug* I know it'll all work out...it's just coming up too fast for me to wrap my head around it. It's a weird feeling, I don't think I'm describing it well... Normal :: Katrina Elam Everybody does it, that's what everybody says As they smoke their cigarettes on Friday night And if you're still a virgin by the time that you're a junior Then the rumor going 'round is you ain't right Maybe I'm hard headed or a little bit old fashioned But I always had a hard time fitting in So when they rolled their eyes at me and told me I ain't normal I always took it as a compliment Where I'm from normal is high school girls having kids Marrying the boys that you grew up with They say girl get your head on straight You sit around and dream all day That far away look in your eye ain't normal Somebody's got to wear the roller skates down at the Sonic But it never really fit into my plans So when I up and moved 1000 miles from Oklahoma Nobody in that town could understand Where I'm from normal is high school girls having kids Marrying the boys that you grew up with They say girl get your head on straight You sit around and dream all day That far away look in your eye ain't normal (But) I say yeah, what's so great about normal I don't know what happens but that's okay 'Cause I know what wouldn't happened if I stayed

I'm finally moved in. It took a while but things are as they should be I guess. I heard this really great song, and I think it sums up my summer. More at the move and all later. Life Ain't Always Beautiful :: Gary Allan Life ain't always beautiful. Sometimes it's just plain hard. Life can knock you down, It can break your heart. Life ain't always beautiful. You think you're on your way. And it's just a dead end road, At the end of the day. But the struggles make you stronger, And the changes make you wise. And happiness has it's own way, Of takin' it's sweet time. No, life ain't always beautiful. Tears will fall sometimes. Life ain't always beautiful, But it's a beautiful ride. Life ain't always beautiful. Some days, I miss your smile. I get tired of walkin' all, These lonely miles. And I wish for just one minute, I could see your pretty face. Guess I can dream, But life don't work that way. But the struggles make me stronger, And the changes make me wise. And happiness has it's own way, Of takin' it's sweet time. No, life ain't always beautiful. But I know I'll be fine. Hey, life ain't always beautiful, But it's a beautiful ride. What a beautiful ride. Missing you with all my heart...<3

I'm here in San Antonio and I'm moving into my house this week. It's exciting and also sad. Postcards and letters Pictures made to last forever To Be boxed up and tossed away Nick-Nacs, Souvenirs In an afternoon Their out of here They disappear without a trace What they mean to me can never be replaced I can't unthink about you I can't unfeel your touch I can't unhear all the words Unsay all the things that used to mean so much I wish I could unremember everything My hearts been through I'm finding out its impossible to do Oh, its no use I can't unlove you In this dance of old songs Like time they go on and on I guess I could learn to do the same I could wake up without you These two arms not around you Tell myself its meant to be this way No matter how I try Some things I can't change. I can't unthink about you I can't unfeel your touch I can't unhear all the words Unsay all the things that used to mean so much I wish I could unremember everything My hearts been through I'm finding out its impossible to do Oh, its no use I can't unlove you I wish I could unremember Everything my hearts been through I'm finding out its impossible to do Its no use I can't unlove you I miss you so much it hurts....<3

Well, this is it y'all. I'm finishing up my packing today and then going out to dinner with Juel and Mason! :) Tomorrow at 1:40 I will be on my way to beautiful San Antonio. 

It doesn't seem real just yet. I don't think I'll believe any of it until I'm on the plane and taking off. 

So, I just wanted to say good luck and have a great summer to you all!

Two more days...it's been so crazy around here lately I haven't really had time to think. Which isn't always a bad thing, especially at this time. 

I'm starting to get excited. Before I was just sad, but I think I'm handling that a little better these days. I was really sad Saturday, but after the conversation I had that night, things feel right. It doesn't really seem fair sometimes, but what can you do about it?

I guess that's really all I have to say...nothing to exciting going on...at least not things I feel like sharing here and now.

Hope all y'all are having a good 4th of July!

This is a beautiful song... You got someone here wants to make it all right Someone that loves you more than life Right here You got willin' arms that'll hold you tight A hand to lead you on through the night Right here I know your heart can get all tangled up inside But don't you keep it to yourself When your long day is over And you can barely drag your feet The weight of the world is on your shoulders I know what you need Bring it on home to me You know I know you like the back of my hand Did you know I'm gonna do all that I can Right here I'm gonna lie with you 'til you fall asleep When the mornin' comes I'm still gonna be Right here Oh, yes I am Take your worries and just drop them at the door Baby, leave it all behind When your long day is over And you can barely drag your feet The weight of the world is on your shoulders I know what you need Bring it on home to me Baby, let me be your safe harbor Don't let the water come and carry you away When your long day is over And you can barely drag your feet The weight of the world is on your shoulders I know what you need Bring it on home to me Oh, bring it on home Yeah, bring it on home to me (home to me) Oh, bring it on (bring it on home to me) You got someone here wants to make it all right Someone that loves you more than life Right here

Where has this summer gone? It doesn't feel like 2 months since we said goodbye to WPI classes. One more week left for me in this state. It's sad but also exciting in a sense. It still doesn't feel real though. It just feels like I'm going to Texas for a vacation like I did last summer. I'm going to be staying with grandparents and in hotels for a month, so it might as well be a vacation. I think July is going to be a sad month for me. Until I move into my house, it's not going to feel right. I'm hoping to just relax and try to have fun. I probably deserve a month without worrying about anything. In other news, I should be finding out about my roommate soon. By tomorrow afternoon, I should have an email about it. But the deadline has been pushed back so many times, with my luck,it'll probably happen again. *sigh* I'm going to miss people here. This state has served me well. I'm ready to move on, I just want to take a few people with me... What Your Soul Really Looks Like
You are a wanderer. You constantly long for a new adventure, challenge, or even a completely different life. You are a very grounded, responsible, and realistic person. People may not want to hear the truth from you, but they're going to get it. You believe that people see you as a bit small and insignificant. People pay more attention to you than you think. Your near future is calm, relaxing, and pretty much what you want. And it's something you've been anticipating for a while now. For you, love is all about caring and comfort. You couldn't fall in love with someone you didn't trust.
Inside the Room of Your Soul
I think that sounds pretty right...any comments? Today was a great day! I loved hanging out with Mason! :) I'm just feeling pretty happy right now.

I don't really have too much to say, so I thought I'd just mention a few things that's happen this week.
    * Took more hours to I get more money/things to do before I quit July 1 * Got a gift card to Staples from one of the women I work with...that will definitely come in handy *Saw Da Vinci Code Tuesday, it wasn't that bad but way too long in my opinion *I'm definitely flying down to Texas, driving got turned down. I'll probably be leaving the second week in July, but reservations still haven't been made. *I'm going to start reviewing French and Calc for the placement tests
That's basically all the new things happening in my life. Bre is graduating Friday, so this weekend will be busy. Then I'll have someone home with me so I won't go totally crazy.

This week hasn't been too exciting. Hang out with Mason Tuesday which is always a good time. :) Most of my time is spent sitting around the house trying to find the energy to exercise. Which has been working so far...now I just have to keep it up.

This weekend was busy. Yesterday was my brother's birthday so we had cake, pie, and other good foods. The rain really put a stop to some ideas, so it wasn't as great as it could have been. 

Last night I finished the Da Vinci Code, it was a good book. I enjoyed his other books better, especially Digital Fortress. I plan on seeing the movie next week and really hope it's not disappointing.

That's about it really....my life isn't that exciting at this point. Just trying to relax and take things in before things get busy in July.

I hope that days come easy and moments pass slow, And each road leads you where you want to go, And if you're faced with a choice, and you have to choose, I hope you choose the one that means the most to you. And if one door opens to another door closed, I hope you keep on walkin' till you find the window, If it's cold outside, show the world the warmth of your smile, More then anything, more then anything, My wish, for you, is that this life becomes all that you want it, To your dreams stay big, and your worries stay small, You never need to carry more then you can hold, And while you're out there getting where you're getting to, I hope you know somebody loves you, and wants the same things too, Yeah, this, is my wish. I think I've finally gotten this relaxing thing down. This week is going much smoother than last week did. Getting out Monday with my mom was fun. Hanging out with Mason yesterday was great. I am a very lucky girl.

I bought the new Rascal Flatts CD yesterday. I've listened to the first half of it and the songs I love. I'm glad I bought the CD. 

The rest of this weeks should be relaxing. I have my final voice lesson Friday, and I'm not really sad about it but I'll definitely get back into singing at Trinity. Saturday will be a busy yet fun day. I'm going for a facial in the morning, :) Then I'm hanging out with friends all evening, it should be a blast! 

I hope everyone else's summers are turning out great.

I haven't really updated in a while, so I thought I'd try now.

Senior Dinner was fun. I enjoyed see everyone again and I think I got some good pictures. The yearbooks turned out nicely and hanging out that afternoon was fun. My grandparents came up and it interesting. I don't really know my grandparents very well, so I was glad to go to the academy thursday and friday morning. My grandma can get on my nerves sometimes and if I'm really tired that tends to happen.

Senior Breakfast was fun. Cute pictures taken again. I came home to balloons and a dozen roses. I also got a cake which was yummy. For presents I got a digital camera! :-D and a pretty diamond necklace. :) Graduation itself was fun, but I left really early. I got kinda sad, so I wasn't up to pushing around people. Being overtired beyond belief also added to things. I went out to dinner at Chili's which was yummy too.

So, overall it was a fun week, but being tired didn't help. This week will be kinda slow. I'm hoping to get my pictures back sometime today or tomorrow. I didn't get my camera until after graduation so I haven't had a chance to use it. I plan on bringing it to parties though and putting it to good use before I move.

I don't really think it's hit me yet that I'm done with high school...it probably won't until I turn up for orientation mid-August.

PS: Like my new icon? It's one of the roses I got for graduation. I wanted to play around with my camera so I took pictures of the pretty flowers. :-D

So, my grandparents are coming this afternoon. I need to finish cleaning and everything before they come. Senior Dinner was nice last night, but it wasn't really great. I wasn't a fan of the table arrangements. *shrug*

I can't wait to get yearbooks tomorrow and graduation should be fun, :)

Things are going well, but I'm getting kinda restless again. I really haven't been doing much, just waiting for graduation I guess. My mom's parents and my dad's dad are coming in Wednesday for graduation. It should be a good time, :)

School is done and it's amazing. Today was wonderful! I'm feel so good right. It's hard to believe that high school is over, but I think I'm ready to move on. This summer is going to be fun, I can already feel it. 

I hope everyone is enjoying the start over summer. :)

Yesterday was amazing. Prom around two was just as good as around one. My friends and my boyfriedd are absolutely amazing and I think I felt like I fit in better this year than last year. It would have been more awkward for me without him. I need to relax after totally stressing myself out this past week. 

Work today was a good break too and I could enjoy my good mood before work ruined it more. So now I'm almost done with question one for paper. Then I'll study half the material for calc and do my lab quiz and probably work on my presentation. Tomorrow I'll do question two, second half of studying and second half of presentation. Today was such a beautiful day, I think I might go work outside, :) I love that the sun is still shining at this time, you've got to love the spring/summer! 

Two more days! I can't wait! Then time to party with my friends, :)

What Color Are You?

BLUES are motivated by INTIMACY, seek opportunities to genuinely connect with others, and need to be appreciated. They do everything with quality and are devoted and loyal friends and employers/employees. Whatever or whomever they commit to are their sole (and soul) focus. They love to serve and will give freely of themselves in order to nurture others lives.BLUES, however, do need to be understood. They have distinct preferences and occasionally the somewhat controlling (but always fair) personality of a confident leader. Their code of ethics is remarkably strong and they expect others to live honest, committed lives as well. They enjoy sharing meaningful moments in conversation as well as remembering special life events (i.e., birthdays and anniversaries). BLUES are dependable, thoughtful, nurturing, and can also be self-righteous, a bit worry-prone, and emotionally intense. They are like sainted pit-bulls who never let go of something once they are committed. When you deal with a BLUE, be sincere, make an effort to truly understand them, and truly appreciate them.
Take this quiz!

Quizilla | Join | Make A Quiz | More Quizzes | Grab Code

I hear from Rice Saturday, not really a big deal, but I've been waiting for the past two months now...it would just be nice to know.

How You Life Your Life
You seem to be straight forward, but you keep a lot inside. You're laid back and chill, but sometimes you care too much about what others think. You prefer a variety of friends and tend to change friends quickly. You tend to always dream of things within reach - and you usually get them.
How Do You Live Your Life?

You Should Be a Song Writer
You have the ability to evoke emotion, tell a story, and hook someone... In a very small amount of words, perhaps with some deft rhyming. Even if you can't write music, you can sure write compelling lyrics. Lyrics so good, people will have them stuck in their heads!
What Type of Writer Should You Be?
The weekend is almost here...I can't wait for it! It feels weird not having a ton of homework to do...but I guess it's nice because I can actually relax at night. My days have been good. I like my compact schedule this term. Even though I still leave at the same time, it's nice not to have a 3pm class.

It feels weird not having to worry about getting everything done. I'm caught up with homework for the most part...just a summary to write and I'm all set. The pace seems much slower this term, but I really haven't been worrying about SISP yet. 

My philosophy class is a good time. It's really making me think about things a lot more though. Sometimes I get a little depressed because the scenarios my book presents aren't good. It amazes me how people can be so closed minded about certain issues. 

I'm feeling pretty lucky right now. Everything seems to be going smoothly. I think I'm pretty set with which college I'm going to. I'm just waiting for Rice because I'm interested in how much they give me. Though I don't even think I'm going to get in. College scares me...I want to live Massachusetts and start my life...but I don't want to leave people behind in the process. I'm so sick and tired of saying goodbye to people, hearing promises that they'll keep in touch, and then after a few months (maybe a year if I'm lucky) I don't hear from them anymore. I don't want that to happen again....I want to keep in touch with people and I want to visit and all that stuff. I can't help but think about next year when I'm lying in bed trying to go to sleep. I just feel a mixture of feelings, and I don't know how to react to the whole situation. *sigh* But right now, I'm happy and I'm pretty lucky that this year has gone better than I expected. It's nice to have a year without fighting or anything like that. I can't wait for Prom either...it's going to be a good time.

I guess that's it for now....have a great night all.

Besides that this week has kinda been sucky. But I think I'm starting to feel better. Philosophy is going to be a blast...I need to find a tree Monday...
